Translation: 1. form, exterior, appearance, face, colour, beauty, picture, image, copy; ad püle 'front, to the front'; ka ad 'other side, back side'; tañi wangku ñi ad 'the colour of the chair'; 2. direction, side, right place; ad lafken '(in) the direction of the sea'; wenu ad püle 'upwards'; 3. habit, custom, trick; ad mapu 'customs of the land'; wesha ad 'bad habit'; 4. relative; ñi adwen 'my relatives, my folk'; also as, ash.
to become beautiful; adüy 'she is beautiful, sympathetic, funny'; adküley 'she looks beautiful, she is being funny, it is in the right place'; also as, ash.
to go in a certain direction;
to arrange, to settle, to point out; adelen rüpü 'show me the road';
to copy, to make a picture/photo of, to bring out, to manage to do something; küme adentuy ñi dungu 'he speaks well';
to pay a last tribute of respect to the deceased;
to make an exact copy of;
to outwit, to manoeuvre, to handle;
to look at, to watch, to observe;
to leave something in the right position/direction/situation;
to be in the right position with respect to, to have the disposal of;
to hold in a certain position; adnien ñi pilun 'I have my ears raised';
present for a deceased relative or close friend to be buried with the body of the deceased;
to put in the right position, to put in the right direction;
to gain an insight, to see the light, to come to an understanding; adüwyu 'wed came to an understanding'.
to have someone for a relative, to look like, to resemble, to carry in a certain direction, to direct in a certain direction, to follow the customs of;
friend to whom one would give an adngel;
to have a pretty face, to be sympathetic;
end; af metawemew 'at the end of a row of jars';
to come to an end; afay kawan 'the fighting will stop'; afküley 'it is coming to an end';
to stop, to cease, to lose interest in;
side, person by one's side, close friend, close to, next to; afkadi ruka 'close to the house'; afkadiley 'he is by my side';
to be by the side of, to assist someone;
continuously, for a long time, since a long time;
to keep someone, to maintain someone; also af-ma-ye-.
to bring to an end, to finish; müchay apümelenew ñi dungu 'he settled my affairs quickly';
to be easy to deal with.
to make full use of, to invest all one's money in;
continuously, for a long time, since a long time; see af-.
to cook, to ripen, to cause to boil;
to put something in a pot to cook;
cooked; afün ilo 'cooked meat'; afün kachu 'matured grass, grass that is ready to be mowed';
to get an inflamed mouth/lips; afüñmawküley ñi wün 'my mouth is infected';
to arrive (here), to reach maturity; cf. puw- 'to arrive (there)';
to be something that ripens easily.
to get, to receive, to have something coming to maturity; iñche akuñman awar 'I have my beans almost ripe';
moon, moonlight; aleley 'it looks like the moon, it looks like moonlight'; alengey 'there is moonlight, there is a moon'.
to damage (plants, seedlings); fey ñi kulliñ allfültuñmaenew ñi poñü 'his cattle damaged my potatoes';
to listen to, to pay attention to;
somewhat, a little (of quality, not quantity); allwe chodi 'yellowish'; allwe ayeyawüy 'he walks around with a faint smile on his face'.
bundle; meñkuniey ñi allwiñ 'she has her bundle on her back'.
to shine, to sparkle, to glitter (by night).
much, very; alü ikey 'he eats a lot'; alüke kamapuley 'they are each very far away';
to become much, to become big;
much, a lot of; niey alün ruka 'he has a lot of houses';
after a long time; also alü-ñma-mew.
to stay for a long time;
to stay for a long time, to take much time; dewma alüñmapaymi? 'have yous been here long?';
in the middle of the night;
spirit of a dead person, dead person;
raised spirit (demon); see witra-; alwe mapu 'land of the dead'; alweley 'he looks like a dead man.
to go, to continue; tunte amuley ~ konüy tachi küyen? 'which day of the month is it?' (lit: 'how far has this month gone/entered?'); mari kiñe antü amuley ~ konüy 'it is the eleventh';
to send, to continue, to start up (a machine);
to loose something which cannot be retrieved; iñche amultukun küchatun witrun komew 'I lost a piece of laundry in the current of the water'; also amu-ntuku-.
is said to men and women. anay has a friendly connotation; eymi amunge, anay '[it is better thatl yous go!'; see (16, 1).

sun, day, weather, one day, daily, in...days, ago; tripay antü 'the sun is up'; fachantü 'today'; nieyiñ weshantü ~ wesha antü 'wep have bad weather'; antü tripantu 'dry year'; fachantü afantüy 'the term has expired today'; alantü ~ rupan antü 'when the sun is high'; rangi antü 'at midday'; ella nagün antü 'when the sun is almost going down'; epe konün antü 'when the sun is about to set';
to be... days ago, to last... days; küla antüy 'it is three days ago';
to stay... days, to have a... day, to get sun; rangi antüñmamen 'I stayed there half a day';
to sunbathe, to have sexual intercourse by day.
in case; anü mawünmali 'in case it rains'.
to sit down, to take root;
to make sit down, to plant;

to sit down on/in, to bewitch; iñche ñi chedkuy ñi ruka anüñmaley kutranmew 'the house of my brother-in-law is full of disease'; anüñmanieñmaen ñi makuñ 'yous are sitting on my poncho'; anüñmaley ñi wekufümew 'he is possessed by demons';

to become dry, to become scorched (by fire), to prick; dew angidüy tüfachi ilo? 'is this meat dry yet?'; iñche angidkülen kütralmew 'I am very close to the fire, I get scorched by the fire'; angidüy ñi trawa ortigamew 'my skin tingled from the nettle.
half, trunk, half-way; angka rüpü wiñomey 'half-way he went back'; angka wenu 'between heaven and earth';
to become half; angkalewey ñi tasa 'my cup is still half full'.
to take someone behind one (on a horse); Sp. llevar en ancas; cf. mankad- (JM) and mangka-tu- (RR); iñche angkadküpalngen 'I was brought here on a horse'; also angkash-.
to become dry/arid (by the sun), to become barren, to dry out; cf. piwü- 'to become dry (what was wet)';
to make something dry on/with something else;
a place to dry something, a thing to dry with;
to become dry/constipated; angküñman ñi pel 'my throat got parched';
remainder of wheat in a sieve.

midget (demon), see (1, 7). añchümalleñ possibly contains añchü 'remainder of wheat in a sieve. Midgets are said to be fond of roasted flour. The anchümalleñ is a small, deformed, childlike creature raised by the witches (kalku) in order to play tricks on people or cause them harm, see (1).
to become very hot/dry (by the heat of fire), to prick; añidtukukünu- pafinge! 'let it dry by the fire!'; añidüy ñi trawa wimamuetew kuri 'my skin itched where a nettle had stung me'.
indigo, Sp. añil; añil takun 'dress dyed indigo'; añilküley 'it appears indigo';
to become full; apoley 'it is full, it is high tide';
to eat stuffed sheep or goat;
to be pregnant, to have a lot of milk (after giving birth);
to help (a child) to walk (not RR).
warm. are is as warm as kufü 'warm' and warmer than eñum 'warm'. are is much more frequent than kufü.
to become warm; areley 'it is warm'; arengey 'it is warm (weather)';
to get inflamed/infected, to get heated (hay); areñmawaymi mi changüllkuwü 'yous will have infected toes'; areñmawüy ketran 'the hay got heated'.
to lend to; are-l- 'to lend to' is more frequent; arelenew kiñe mansun 'he lent me one ox';
to lend something; arengülümkelan plata mapuchemew 'I don't lend money to a Mapuche';
to borrow from; aretuenew ketran ~ aretuketranenew 'he borrowed wheat from me';
borrowed; fey re aretun ropa niey 'he only has borrowed clothes'.
to get burnt, scorched; ariñüy ñi iyal 'my food got burnt';
to become blue; asulüy 'it became blue, it is blue (always)'; asulküley 'it is blue (now), it looks blue'; asulngey 'it is partly blue, there is some blue';
to get bored; Sp. aburrirse; auriwkülen 'I am bored'.
a small portion of something to be roasted, movement of hot air above hot sand or above a fire, glowing embers;
to ride around the deceased; awü-ñma-. The deceased is placed on a bier and the visitors at the funeral ride several rounds on horseback around the bier to pay a last tribute of respect.
wild horse, herd; Qu. awqa 'enemy, rebel';
to become wild, to go to war;
to play, to play a match;
to hurt, to cause pain to; awüenew ñi fotüm, kom fendeñmaenew ñi kulliñ 'my son hurt me, he has sold all my cattle'; awüngellan 'how miserable I am!';
to ride around the deceased (MM); see awi-ñma.
fairly, somewhat, not very, rather; fachantü aymüñ alingkülen 'I have a little fever today';
to like, to love; feyengu ayümewüy 'theyd love each other';
to become/be happy/content; müna ayüwüy iñchiu yu puwel 'he was very glad that wed came';
shadow; cf. llawfeñ 'shade'; aywiñ kütral 'shadow caused by the light of the fire';
says a child to his father, also tata ~ tatay. chacha ~ chachay is more affectionate.
to contain salt; chadingelay ti korü 'there is no salt in the soup';
to catch a cold, to cough; amualmi wekun, makuntunge, chafoafuymi wütremew 'if yous go outside, put on a coat, yous might catch a cold';
skeleton, framework; chakülküley '[the fence] is a skeleton (shows saps)';
to clean an animal untill you are left with the bones.
to say hallo to, to say words of welcome to;
black dress for women which leaves one shoulder bare and reaches down to the ankles;
to put on a chamall; chamalltukünungey 'she was put on a chamall'.
to put someone's hair into braide.
to hatch out, to come out of the egg;
human being, person; fentren che 'lots of people'; ñi pu che 'my family, my folk';
to be sober, to be healthy.
(maternal) grandfather, grandchild; chedkingean 'I will have grandchildren'.
father-in-law (of a man), son-in-law (of a man);
to bound, to bounce; chefkülpüramfin ti pelota 'I made the ball bounce up'.
to squat, to sit down on one's heels.
what?, which?; cf. tuchi; chem rume 'whatever'; chemmew nu rume 'not under any circumstachemyewüymu? 'how are youd related?'.
where?, from where?, whereto?; chew tuwüymi? 'where are yous from?'; chew rume 'wherever'; chew nu rume 'nowhere'.

fireball; cherufe (RR). A fireball, which appears with loud noises coming from volcanoes and mountains, is held responsible for a volcanic eruption. In old stories, the chewürfe is a giant who keeps girls in captivity and robs people of their head. Pieces of the chewürfe, probably pieces of meteorites, are used by the machi to predict the future.
to leave, to go out, to turn out; see tripa-.
to become yellow/#800000; chodüy 'it is yellow/orange'.
flying head. The chonchon is a demon which appears at night as a flying head or a bird. The witches send the chonchon out to cause harm to mankind.
to put out, to extinguish, to switch off; allkütulelen, wadküle, chongümelaen 'listen for me, if it boils, put [it] out for me'.
to drip, to flow; chüdküley ti ko 'the water is running'.

to do how/what?; chuman? 'what must I do?'; welu fewla chum- petuy chemay, müchay pun ka nütramkatuafin 'but what he is up to now..., I will have a word with him again in a little while this evening'; chumngen? 'what did they do to me?';
for what purpose?; chumal eluafiymi iyal? 'what do yous bring her food for?';
in no case, by no means (RR); also chum-ka-w-mew nu rume.
how?; chumngechi chi kimafuyiñ? 'how could wep know?'; chumngechi wirarülleli rume iniy rume allküñmalayaenew 'no matter how hard I scream, no one will hear me';
while; see (3, 2); chumngenkechi akun 'I arrived one way or another'; chumngenunkechi akun 'I arrived without trouble';
to feel how about, to think what of;

when?, recently, at some time, once; chumül amuaymi chile? 'when will yous go to Chile?'; chumül ngemen nga 'I have once been there, I have been there recently'; chumül rume 'any time'; chumül nu rume 'never';
when?, recently, at some time; see chum-.
round; chüngküd ~ chüngküs ~ chüngkür (RR); also chüngküsh;
to declare one's love to someone, to woo.
to consult, to submit a proposal to someone;
already, any more (with negation), after; dew pürapuy 'he is already at the top'; dew duamwelay 'there is no need any more'; dew mütrümkünueyu, iñche amutun 'after I called you, I walked away';
to draw to a close, to end; iñchiu kiñew dewüy tayu küdaw 'wed were done with ourd work simultaneously'.
almost, nearly, about to; dewma afüy 'it was about to end'; dewma alüñmapaymi? 'have yous been here long?';
to make, to finish; kim dewmaiyallay 'he does not know how to cook'.
to reach, to attain, to catch up with; also di-tu-.
to have sexual intercourse with (a woman).

more. doy is also used to form the comparative and the superlative of an adjective or adverb; küla doy fentren epumew 'three [is] more than two'; doy fentreley 'he is bigger'; fey itrokommew doy inanngey 'he is the youngest of all';
to surpass; doyüy ñi chaw 'he is taller than his father'.
need, attention; ülkantuken ñi ñuke ñi duam 'I sing for my mother'; also doam;
to want, to need, to care for; iñche duamfiñ tüfachi domo 'I need this woman'; duamüymi kiñe galleta? 'do yous want a cookie?'; duamlan no ~ duamkülelay 'he does not care';
to have a business to attend to.
to need something or someone for a purpose; duamyefin ñi chaw 'I need to see my father (about something)'; duamkülelay 'he is not in a hurry, he has got plenty of time';
to think (of). As a second member of a compound duam- may indicate that the situation or event referred to is half way completed (see 29.1); rüngümduamfin 'I was half way with themilling';
dark; iñche anülen dumiñmew 'I am sitting in the dark';
idea, matter, language, word; also mapu-dungu-n; ramtuenew tüfachi dungu 'he asked me this (question)'; iñchiu allküfiyu feychi dungu 'wed heard that story';

to let someone or something behind, to leave someone or something in a certain condition; elelürputuafiymi 'on your way back yous must leave it there for him'; dew kümeelküley 'it has already been taken care of, it is already fixed';
to entrust someone with something or someone; elfalfiñ ñi püñeñ 'I entrusted her with my baby'.
to choose, to select; Sp. elegir.
to give to; cf. wül- 'to give something'; elungekefuyiñ iyal 'wep were given food'; iñchiu eluwyu kuwü 'wed shook hands';
to give permission to someone, to allow someone; iñche lleküpuel, eluñmangelan ñi konal 'when I had come near, I was not alloweed to enter'.
a bit, shortly after; ella nagün antü 'when the sun is going down a little bit (shortly after noon)';
in a little while, at first; also ella-ka-mu (RR).
to hide; also ellka-l-; ellkalüñmafichi? 'shall I hide it from him?';
at that time, then, well; Sp. entonces.
to perform an abortion on someone;
to become very hungry, to become starved;
to deceive; Sp. engañar; enggañacheley 'he is cheating people'.
defective, handicapped; engkañngeymi mi lipang 'yours arm is deformed'; rume engkañngey 'he has many handicaps'.
theyd;engu after C, yengu after V.
theyp; engün after C, yengün after V; Payllalef engün 'the family Payllalef'.
to make warm, to think something is warm.
almost, nearly; epe akuley 'he is almost there'; epewün 'at dawn, at daybreak'.
to get a pair of twins.
to eat; also yi-, often in case of a preceding vowel; y- before V; iyalafiymi tüfa 'yous must not eat that'; iñche küpa yiwelan 'I don't want to eat any more';
to make someone eat; yiyikünufiñ 'I ate that very quickly'; also i-lel-tu-.
to know how to cook; also kim dewma-yael-;
scythe; also ichuna; Sp. echona ~ echuna.
meat; ilo trokifiñ 'it looks like meat to me';
to despise, to depreciate (MM); iñche pobrengelu nga iñche illamngekefun 'when I was poor, I used to be despised'.
to make someone angry; also illku-l-ka-.
to become angry, to make oneself angry;
to call someone names, to abuse someone (MM) see 27.2 for -mpe- ~ -ñpe- improd. suffix.
to feel like, to get an appetite for; rume illulen serbesa 'I very much feel like a beer'; illuniengen tañi langümngeal 'they want to kill me'.
along, next to, near, behind; ina lewfü trekan 'I walked along the river';
to follow, to go behind someone; petu alüley rüpü ñi inayal 'it is still a long way to go'; inamefin 'I went behind her';
side, near, next to; inafül lewfü trekan 'I walked close to the river'; fey ñi inafül ngillay mapu 'he bought land next to him';
to get near/next to (-mew); inafülküley 'it is close by';
bank, side, next; pu inal 'the next ones';

along, alongside, next to. ina-l-tu is more frequent than ina (Adv). ina ~ inaltu ruka 'next to the house'; inaltu lewfü trekan 'I walked on the banks of the river (following exactly the course of the river)'; inaltu wingkul 'at the foot of the mountain, around the mountain (following its outline)'; inayawün 'I walked about behind', cf. inaltuyawün 'I walked about alongside';
to sow late, to put in the soil late;
last, younger, youngest; fey itrokommew doy inanngey 'he is the youngest of all';
last, behind; feytüfa doy inangechi akuy feytüfachi epu chemew 'he arrived after these two people'.
to join in, to follow someone in; iñche pefilu imeken Pati iñche ka inayengüñün 'when I saw Pati eating I also got hungry';
to cry with someone (in order to give comfort);
side, near, next to; see ina-.
who?; also iniy; iniyemu ngemeymi Santiago? 'with whom have yous been to Santiago!; iney rume 'whoever'; iney nu rume 'nobody whatsoever'.
quite, completely, straight; occurs only in compounds;
all sorts; itrofill dungu nütramkawayiñ 'wep are going to talk about all sorts of things';
all, everybody; itrokommu trapümün plata 'I collected money from everybody';
area before/in front of something, before (space or position); itrotripa rukamu nen kiñe wangku 'I have a chair in front of my house'.

other, different, also, again, and; kake che 'other people'; ka tasa 'a different cup'; ka semana 'next week'; ka ñidolküley 'he is also the leader'; ka lantuy 'he became a widower again'; dewmay ñi ruka ka kintuy kiñe domo 'he built his house and looked for a woman'; kañ püle 'on the other side';
to be different (not character); kaleay chi tañi pipingen 'perhaps he will strike a different note';
to be different (character); kangey 'he is different, he is peculiar';
to visit a neighbour, to move next to a person;
grass, pasture; eymi ta küpalelafilu ta kachu 'yous must bring him grass';
to make an animal graze, to pasture.
person next to another person, bosom friend, companion, advisor;
to be next to a person;
to have someone at one's side;
to put aside, to catch up with someone.
to crow, to make the sound of a cock; also kakakü-; kakara- (MM), kakaya- (JM); kiñetu kakaküle alka 'at the first crowing sound of the cock, at dawn'.
pubic hair, hair in the armpits; kal küwü 'hair on one's hand'; kal ufisha 'fleece of a sheep'.

witch. Witches, usually male, occasionally female, bring harm to people and animals. They use stones, birds and supernatural creatures like the añchümalleñ, the chonchon and the witranalwe for their practice of witchcraft. Witches are held responsible for illness and death.
wild plant with long roots; Liertia ixiodes iridacea, iridacea (Augusta). The roots of the plant are used to make a comb.

to become purple, to be purple, to make purple; kallfüy 'it is purple (permanent characteristic)'; petu kallfüy 'it is becoming purple'; kallfüley 'it is purple (having become purple)'; kallfüngey 'it has purple'.
enabling; see 25.4; kalli amupe! 'let him gol';
to be at ease, to feel at ease; kallikawküdawkülen 'I am working without hurry'.
or; feyta kam kangelu? 'this one or the other one?'; iniy doy kimüy, eymi kam iñche? 'who knows more, yous or me?'.
big quantity (RR); kaman (MM); iñche kaman ilo nien 'I have a lot of meat'; kamalekefuy che 'there were a lot of people'.
shepherd, guardian (a person or a dog); kulliñ kamañ 'herdsman'.
pod; füreke kapi may tüfachi trapi 'this red pepper has hot seed-pods'.
town. Is an old word, still found in names of places, e.g. Karawe.
green, raw; pilang ~ pülang karü 'light-green'; kurü karü 'dark-green';
to become green, to be green.
to become grey, to be grey.
to cut, to mow, to cut someone off; iñche katrün ñi changüllkuwü 'I cut my finger'; katrükonkilnge kangelu petu nütramkale! 'don't interrupt someone when he is talking!';
to cut unwittingly, to pull to pieces;
to cut off, to cut without wanting to;
room (in a house), part that is out off;
to cut someone off, to block someone's way, to bump against (-mew);
horse; also kawellu; Sp. caballo; also kaweyu;
horse; Sp. caballo; kawel(ü) is more frequent.
to mount a horse behind another person;
to sit/ride on something or someone, as if on a horse;
a piece of wood to spoon something out with.
spoon, a thing to spoon something out with;
to cackle (sound made by a hen after laying an egg) (JM), cf. kuchacha-.
rheum (in the corners of the eye when waking up).
waterplant; probably consisting of keñkeñ(?) and ko 'water'.
to hit, to beat (to defeat), to fight; kewakewangekiy 'they were fighting all the time'; kewafin 'I hit him, I fought with him'; kewangen 'I was hit, I was beaten';
to fight, to combat, to go to war against; ka kisuke dewmayngün ñi mapuche tralka ñi kewatuafiyem ti pu ñuwa 'each one of themp prepared his Mapuche gun in order to fight the thieves'.
necklace (silver necklace with a coin on each link).
to know how to, see 25.4; kim dungulay 'he does not know how to speak';

to know, to learn (to gain knowledge of, to be informed), to remember; kimüñmalafin ñi rakiduam 'I don't know what his thoughts are'; iñche kimlan 'I don't know'; iñche pichi kimnien 'as far as I know'; kimnuchi pichiche 'innocent child'; iñche petu kimün fey akulu fey 'I have just learned that he has arrived'; newe küme kimnielan 'I don't remember very well';
to teach, to let someone know;
to let someone know (as a warning);
to make oneself known; kimfaluwpalay 'when he came in, he did not make himself known'.
to be prudent, sensible, conscious, aware;
to have known for some time;
to look for, to search, to look;
to look for trouble, to pick a quarrel with someone;
to be looking for all kind of stuff for oneself, to be shopping.
to whine (sound made by a dog);
to imitate the whining of a dog;

one, once, about/more or less (with numbers), single. kiñe is sometimes used as an indefinite article. kiñe umameyu 'wed stayed there one night'; kiñe püle 'on one side'; kiñe rume 'if only one'; kiñe nu rume 'not even one'; kiñe epu küyen 'for about two months'; kiñe mufü 'quite a few';
each one; kake kiñeke yenieyiñ makuñ anu mawünle 'wep take each of us a coat with us in case it rains';
some, a few, one by one, one each;
some; kiñekentu tripayiñ 'some of usp left';
to be one, to be single/alone;
first, unique, alone, for the first time, (for) once;

alone, self/own (giving emphasis to the individual character of the person referred to); kishu ~ kisu (RR, MM). kishu is also used as a substitutive personal pronoun, see 15.1. kishu küdawkülen 'I am working alone'; kishukentu amuayu 'wed will go alone (each of us)'; kishu dunguaymew eymi 'he will talk to yous himself'; kishu engün amufaltunofel 'theyp should not go';
on one's own initiative, for one's own account.
clay to make pipes from, also a place-name;
sweet (sugar, appels, oranges), as opposed to kotrü 'salt, sour';
to become sweet, to be sweet;
brown, reddish brown, beige; also kollü;
to become brown, to be brown.
brown, reddish brown, beige; see kolü.
all, entire, completely; kom kurü 'entirely black'; kom pun 'all nights, the entire night'; iñche ta kom kimün 'I know everything'.
comrade; Sp. compañero; kompañwen 'friends/partners of one another';
to accompany; fey müna kümey kompañkiawülünmew 'he is very good to hang around with'.

to enter, to start; konpange! 'come in!'; fücha konüy 'it is deep'; tunte konüy tachi küyen? 'which day of the month is it?'; mari kiñe antü konüy 'it is the eleventh'; konayiñ nganün 'wep will begin to sow/plant'; kiñe füta firemamew konün 'I joined a big firm'; konün antü 'when the sun goes down'; konün pun 'at nightfall';
to sit down in, to move in with in-laws;
to get the heat of the sun;
to get, to take in; konmay trufür ñi nge 'I got dust in my eye';
to enter, to go into, to invade; ruka kontungen 'my house was broken into';
to take courage, to pretend to be a young man;
sheaf; kongka küna 'a bundle of reed'.
to become purple, to be purple;
baby/young (of a woman or an animal), child of a woman's sister(-in- law) or brother(-in-law); koñi (RR);
to give birth; kiñe koñün waka 'a cow which has calved'.
to hold in a face downward position.
fence, yard; Sp. corral; mamüll koral 'wooden fence'.
(at) the end of the harvest season.
faded, greyish (colour of dirty white clothes), foul; kotror che 'foul/dirty people'.
to be salt; rume kotrüy lafkenko 'seawater is very salt'; kotrüy ti kesu 'this cheese is (too) salt'; kotrüy ti mansana 'the apple is sour';
to salt; kotrülngey ti korü 'the soup was salted';
lie, deceitful; iñche koyla dungu pin 'I told a lie';
to get wet; kuchulen 'I arn wet';
old, old woman; also kuse; see kushe
to play (in a contest/game), to bet;
to have a horse running a race;
millstone (the bottom stone which does not move);
the millstone on top of the bottom stone.
to lie down, to go to bed.
to become warm; kufüy ko 'the water has warmed up';
to pay someone; fey kom kullieyiñmu 'he paid all of us';
to wash one's face, to wash the face of someone.
to slap with the palm of the hand or with a whip;
drum (wooden dish covered by a goat's skin, is used by the machi);
to swell up, to inflate, to become inflamed.
to feel pity/sorry for, to take care of.
to beat someone up with a stick;
to give someone a good beating.
to fasten (a baby) to the cradleboard;
stone, rock; la kura 'loose rock, rock debris' (lit. dead stone); mongen kura 'solid rock' (lit. living stone);
to have a wife, to get married (to a woman);
to have sexual intercourse with a woman.
husband and wife; kiñeke wariyamew kurengepuyngün 'some got married in town and stayed there';
to take for a wife, to marry;
black, dark; kurükelü 'dark-red'; kurükechiley 'it seems black';
to become black, to be black; kurüy 'it is black (always)', cf. kurüley 'it is black (has become black)'; kurüngey 'it has black (in it)'.
old woman, granny, old (woman, house); also kude, kuse.
to (be middle-aged and) get older, to advance in years;
to be in the process of becoming an old woman.
to get old; kushenagüy 'she has become old (and did not get any children or has not travelled anywhere)';
formerly, a long time ago, former; kuyfi rume mülekefuy feychi dungu 'in earlier days these things happened a lot'; iñche nütramkan kiñe kuyfi che iñchiu 'I talked to an elderly person.
bridge which consists of one pole or a framework of poles which rests on either side of a stream or a river;
to do all kind of jobs;
to have difficulty to, to take trouble to; iñche küdawtun kimal olandes 'I had difficulty learning Dutch'.
to swell; iñche küfiwkülen ñi pütra 'my stomach is swollen'.
to soak, to drench; also kültraf-.
sort of fern, used to cover wounds and heal them.
bar of a loom (the upper and lower bar of a loom on which the warp threads are stretched).
to lean down; külürupan antü 'after midday, around 14.00 hours, when the sun is going down';
tear (RR); külle-wün (JM); apoliy tañi nge küllewünmew 'her eyes are full of tears'.
to climb a hill in a zigzagging manner.
to burst open (grain, corn while being roasted); küllewküllewerkiy 'it is on the verge of bursting open'.
good, nice, well; küme che 'good person'; müna küme dungu! 'how good!, isn't that good!'; müna küme adngey 'she looks very pretty'; küme antü 'good/nice weather';
to be good/nice; feyta doy kümey 'this one is better'; kümey 'it is good, it tastes good';
to do right (to), to be good at, to treat well; kümelkan ñi amunuel 'I made the right decision by not going';
to be (doing) allright, to be well off;
to brighten up, to become better;
to be good/well done/allright; kümeley 'he is allright (not sick)';
to be good, to be nice weather.
to let someone be, to treat someone well;
to like, to think it is nice/good;
to experience something good, to have a good day;
reed, used for thatching (about one rnetre high green, flexible grass); küna ruka 'a house with a thatched roof'.
wishing, see 25.4; upa (JM); küpa amulafuyiñ 'wep did not want to go'; küpa pütokon 'I like to drink water'.
to come; pichi küpange! 'come here for a second!';
to bring; küpaleleyu tüfa 'I brought this for yous'; llüngüdküpa-l- 'to drag this way (in the direction of the speaker)'; rütreküpal- 'to push this way (in the direction of the speaker).
family (group of persons descended from a common ancestor); probably related to küpa- 'to come'.
sister of a man's wife, sister's husband (of a woman); kürunwen iñchiu 'wed [are] kürun'.
wind; kürüfngey 'there is wind'; kürüftukumawünngey 'it is windy and stormy';

even, also; kütu (RR); kom amuayiñ wariyamew, fey küto amuay 'wep will all go to town, even he'; iñche witranmamean ñi lamngen welu ñi chaw küto pemean 'I will go and visit my sister but I will see my father too'.
fire; anükonkülen kütralmew 'I am sitting near the fire';
to make fire, to light a fire, to burn; kütraltufiy mamüll 'he set fire to the wood, he burned the wood'.
to wring; kütrüfiñ ti ropa 'I wrung water out of the clothes'.
to tie, to bind, to wrap up (in a shawl or a piece of cloth).
moon, month, monthly, in months, months ago;
to elapse (a month), to be a month ago, to spend a month.
deceased, corpse, dead; la wentru 'dead man'; la kura 'loose rock, rock debris' (lit. dead stone);
to die; petu lay 'he is dying';
to be still-born, to die of boredom;
to be dying, to be half-dead;
to kill; langümngey 'he was killed'; langümüñmangen tañi fotüm 'I was confronted with the death of my son';
to lose someone (through death); iñche layelün ñi ñuke 'I lost my mother (she died)';
to stretch (out), to comb; lapümüñmuwan 'I am going to strech my legs'.
to divide, to split, to break (bread), to crack (nuts), to cut (apple, wood); lakafiñ kofke 'I broke the bread';
sister (of a woman or a man), brother (of a woman), children of father's brother and children of mother's sister (of a woman);
to become thick/sturdy/swollen; lantrakünuñmakeeymu tañi trawa tati nerüm 'that flee caused yous a swollen skin'.
to become hairless/featherless (animals only); lawüy ñi kal ufisha 'the sheep lost its fleece';
to make (a person or an animal) run; also lef-ül-;
to run away from; also lef-ma-w-tu-.
not to be able to sleep again;
to hit, to touch; legniey kechu 'he has got five hits';
to guess right, to hit in a deliberate attempt; also leg-ül-.
to have a quick look at;
to be focused; leliniefin 'I am watching her';
to look at (a less examining, less conscious way of looking than leli-);
to be able to carry/lift something; kiñe fücha wangku eluen, lemlafin, feymew küpaltulafin 'yous gave me a big couch, I could not carry it, [and] therefore I did not bring it';
to produce milk (a woman or a cow);
to clean, to wipe; we liftuley 'it has just been cleaned'; liftuñmafiy ñi arof 'he wiped off his sweat'; liftun che 'proper people'; liftuwün che 'people who take good care of themselves.
white (RR); also lir; cf. lüg (LQ, MM).
to turn white, to show white (snow, ice, laundry); lingamkünuan ñi sabana 'I am going to have my sheets white';
morning, in the morning, early; rume liwen puwün 'I arrived very/too early';
tomorrow morning; müna küme liwen(antü)ngiy! 'it is a beautiful morning!';
wolf, wild; Sp. lobo; lofo kawellu 'wild horse (not tame)';
to make wild, to scare, to frighten.
flute, a plant; Senecio otites Kuze, fam. Compositae (Augusta). The plant has 1.5 meter long, hollow branches which are used to make a flute.
hole; lolomu ta ngürü 'the fox [is] in his hole';
a lake with many holes (in which the frogs live);
to have a hole, to have holes;
to be inside a hole; also lolo-kon-küle-;
to get burnt, to burn; lüfüy ñi kuwü 'my hand got burnt'; lüfay, külüay antü 'the sun will turn red and go down';
to burn, to set fire to;
to set fire to something big; also lüp-om-tuku-;
to become white, to be white;
sling (ropes with metal balls at the end).
to lie flat on one's stomach.
to burn, to set fire to; see lüf.

to drip (MM); lüylüyküley ta che 'that man is dripping'.
to become sad, to get angry. For MM and JM lladkü- means above all 'to get angry'; iñche lladkün kutranlu ñi ñuke 'I got distressed because my mother fell ill';
to make sad, to cause grieve to;
to rebuke someone (MM); also illku-ñpe-; for (-ñpe-), see 27.2;
part, half. llag is not exactly a half, but rather a big part, cf. angka 'half ' and rangiñ 'middle'. llag eluen 'give me a part'; llagküley ñi kulliñ 'it is a part of my cattle';

to drink a toast to someone, to offer a drink to someone; probably derived from llag 'part'. Someone proposes a toast to a friend, drinks from his glass and offers his glass to his friend. llagkünungey 'he was proposed a toast'.
mother-in-law (of a man), son-in-law (of a woman);
to have a mother-in-law/son-in-law relationship with someone.
beads of glass (used to make a necklace), necklace. These beads are also used to fill the wada 'rattle'.
to drop; ñi tasa llangkümüy 'she dropped her cup';
to drop something in something else.
to sit down in the shade.
to grow, to come up (seedlings); antümew müchay llegkiy ngan 'thanks to the sun the seeds come up quickly'; tayiñ llegmum '[the land] where wep grew up';
to make seeds come up (the sun);
to grow, to cultivate; petu llekümfiñ sanaoria 'I am growing carrots'; llekümküleluley 'it looks like a nursery'.
to approach, to draw near (-mew). llekü- obligatorily contains a direction marker. iñche lleküpuel, eluñmangelan ñi konal 'when I had drawn up very close, I was not allowed in';
to request, to ask from; llellipupifin ta domo ñi küpayal 'I asked the woman there if she came'.

to melt (MM); cf. lluw- (LQ, RR), llüw- (JM).
to sense, to notice (MM); cf. lluwatu-;
to be on the watch for, to be attentive to.
to come loose, to loosen; llocholey 'it is loose'; llochowüy trewa 'the dog set itself free';
to receive; llowüñmaenew ñi dungu 'he received my message';
to catch in, to receive in; llowtufiy ti ketran 'he caught the wheat (in his hands, when the bag burst open)'.
to bend over, to bow down; lloyüy ti ketran 'the wheat bent over (with the weight of its spikes)';
deep; llufüngerkiy, konpulayaymi 'it is deep, yous must not go in there'; feytati llufü(n) lafken 'that [is] a deep lake'.
something secret, in secret (not RR); pu llum 'in secret'.
to melt; cf. lliw- (MM), llüw- (JM); lluwüy trangliñ 'the ice has melted'.
to sense, to notice, to be on the watch for; lluwatuniefalün 'I have to be alert, I have to watch [it]'.
to become afraid, to fear; llükangey 'he was feared';
someone who gets frightened easily, fearful person;
to be frightened easily, to be fearful.

to brood; llüpañmaniey lü kuram 'she is hatching out her eggs'; kiñe llüpañ achawall 'a broody chicken' (JM);
medicine woman, medicine man (but usually a woman). On the basis of her capacity to communicate with the Gods, the machi performs a key role in rituals such as the ngillatun and the machitun.
to cure someone, to perform a healing practice (as a machi) on behalf of someone.
to arrange burning logs in order to stir the fire; also masomtuku-; probably derived from madom (N) 'burning log' (Augusta); mosomtukufiñ mamüll kütralmew 'I put wood in the fire'.
to pay a brideprice to the (family of the) fiancée;
the exchange of gifts at the occasion of a wedding.
fenced area (to keep animals from straying).
colour chart, pattern book; also malü-we;
to go through; malütuñmafiñ ñi maleta 'I went through his suit-case';

uncle, nephew. Originally malle referred to an uncle and nephew from father's side. My informants use weku 'uncle from mother's side' to refer to an uncle from father's as well as mother's side. One female informant referred to the husband of her mother's sister as malle. malle is found in the following compounds:
husband of the sister of a man's mother, brother of a woman's father, stepfather;
nephew (son of a man's brother), stepson;
niece (daughter of a man's brother), wife of the son of a man's brother, stepdaughter.
to boast; mallmawkefuy ñi nien fentren kulliñ 'he used to boast that he had a lot of catlle';
right (in contrast with left), the right; ñi man püle '(on) my right hand/side'; epu man küwü nen 'I have got two right hands';
to be on the right side.
to order, to send; Sp. mandar.
to vouch for/to stand surety for, to trust; iñche kiñe warangka manelayu 'I will lend yous hundred peso's';
to be trustworthy, to be a trusty.
to take someone on the back (of a horse) (JM); cf. angkad- and mangkatu-.
to take someone on the back (of a horse) (RR).
to kick; welemew mangküfiy 'he kicked him with the left [foot].
land, ground, earth, country; rüngalfin mapumew 'I buried him in the ground';
far; kamapu tuwün 'I came from far away'; also ka-mapu;
quick(ly), fast; kiñe matu amuachi wampo doamün 'I want a boat that goes fast'; feychi wentru rume matungiy 'that man is very fast';
quickly, fast; matuke kimelngepe Pedro 'let him inform Pedro quickly/at once!';
to hurry; matukelnge! 'hurry up!'; matukelküley 'he is going fast'.
place with a lot of wood.
to rain; petu mawünüy 'it is raining';
to get rain; mawünmapalan 'I did not get rain on my way here';
see 325-327. may is also used to confirem what has just been said; 'yes, certainly, sure, that's right', etc. maymay is used not only as a firm confirmation, but also as a greeting ('hallo');
to agree to, to obey, to want; maypeay chi ñi chaw 'I am not sure if my father will consent';
to say yes to, to agree to, to want.
to wave to (to indicate a direction), to lure;
to wave hallo/goodbye to, to give signs to.
to tie the legs of an animal;
excrement, crap (humans and animals); me nümünngey 'it smells of crap';
to defecate, to crap; also me-me-tu-;
to be busy; mekekaymi küdawün? 'are yous still busy working?'; wisake sungu mekefiy 'he is involved in bad things'.
to bleat; memekükey ufisha 'a sheep bleats'.
to sling up [a load] on one's back; meñkuniey ñi allwiñ 'she carries her bundle on her back';
earthen vat which is carried on the back.
to become full; meñoy 'it has filled up'; epe meñoliy 'it is almost full';
full; kiñe meñon metawe 'a full jar'.
dried and milled pepper; probably derived from medkü- 'to grind, to crumble' (Augusta).
to carry around, to have on one's person, to wear; fey miawülüy aretun ropa 'he walks around in borrowed clothes'.
to farm in common; Qu. minkaku- 'to hire labourers'.
bottom, space underneath, under, underneath; miñche karüy 'the bottom is green'; miñche ruka(mew) fentreley dewü 'underneath the house there are a lot of mice'.
person who eats from the same plate;
to share food with someone; iñchiu mishawayu korfimew 'wed are going to eat the soup together'.
two or more persons who have a misha-relation with oneanother (good friends);
to change (clothes), to move (house); Sp. mudarse.
to drink/eat blood, to get stained with blood; karü mollfüñtuy tati che 'that guy drinks/eats raw blood'.
to escape, to manage to get away, to survive; meli montuyiñ, kiñe lay 'the four of us escaped, one died';
to save, to set someone free;
to heap up, heap; Sp. montón.
to get life, to recover (to get well again);
to resuscitate, to heal, to cure;
to perk up, to pick up, to make a living;
to keep oneself alive, to support oneself, to be feeling better again;
to be alive, to be healthy, to live;
something that keeps one alive (wheat, harvest, food).
something globe-shaped, round (spherical); cf. triwür 'something round (circular)'.
to make fat, to fatten (up); also motri-l-tu-;
fat; niey motriñke ufisha 'they have got fat sheep'.
to breast-feed; dew moyolülmi mi püñeñ, kellupayaen 'when you have fed yours child, yous must come and help me';
song of a blackbird; also moyotiltiltil.
sort of chicha (liquor made of maize, wheat or peas). MM and JM use muday to refer to liquor made of wheat only; cf. muska 'maize liquor'; uwamuday 'maize liquor';
to become muday, to make muday of; mudayfiñ ti ketran 'I made muday of the wheat'.
how much?, some; also müfü; mufü duamüymi? 'how much do yous want?'; müfü yall nieymi? 'how many children do yous have?'; kiñe mufü 'some';

especially, precisely (when mungel follows the noun phrase it modifies), always (not MM); chew mungel ngemeymi? 'where exactly have yous been?'; pukem mungel müna dumiñngey 'especially in the summer it is very dark'; mungel ngepayawkiymi faw? 'do yous always hang around here?'; ngollilekiymi mungel! 'yous are always drunk!'.
liquor of maize (not LQ); cf. muday.
to stumble, to trip, to run into;
in a little while, soon, fast; iñche müchay amuan pilen 'I intend to go soon'; müchay eluayu 'I will give [it] to yous in a little while'; müchay pürange! 'go up fast!';
all the time; müchayke konpay pichike achawall 'the little chickens come in all the time'.
at once, immediately; müchaymüten pürange 'go up at once!';
how much?, some; is infrequent; cf. mufü.
to tighten down, to fasten down (e.g. reed onto a bamboo cane in order to make a thatched roof).

to be (in a place), to live (to reside); kamel mülemen Arxentina 'I was in Argentina last year'; iñche üyüy mülen, welu fewla faw mülepan 'I live over there, but I am here now'; iñche ñi mülen 'the place where I live'. In combination with a possessive pronoun (indicating the subject) and a nominalized verb form müley forms a debitive construction, e.g. müley mi allküal 'yous must listen', see 26.4.72.
very, a lot, too much; müna asiy 'she is very pretty'; müna ikey 'he eats a lot, he eats too much'.
to be good at something, to be handy; münaliy ta tekimu 'she is good at weaving'; münaliy ti wentru 'that man is skilful'.
to take a bath, to bath someone.
pair, couple, in pairs, together; tüfachi epu mesa mür femngerkiy 'these two tables seem to be a pair'; tayu epu püñeñ mür amuy engu Temuko 'my two sons went to Temuco together';
to choke (over); iñche mürin 'I choked'; mürifiñ ti pan 'I choked over the bread';
to make roasted flour, to grind; mürkechi, yewüntukuan ta mürke 'let's make mürke, [then] I will take it with me as a present'.
very, (too) much; müte küme dunguy 'he speaks very well'; müte dunguy 'he talks a lot'; müte küpakelay 'he comes almost never';
very, (too) much; mütewe no 'it [is] not (too) much'.

merely, only, after all, nevertheless, yet; müten (MM, JM); iñche nien küla peso, eymi nieymi kiñe mütem 'I have three peso's, yous have got only one'; ipe mütem! 'let him just eat!'; iñche mütem küdawken 'I am the only one who works'; pichintuy mütem 'he has been here for just a little while'; dew lay ñi ñuke welu iñche amutuan mütem 'my mother died but I will go all the same';
merely, only, after all, nevertheless, yet (MM, JM); cf. mütem.
lower level, lowland; naw (JM); nagmapumu 'in the lowlands';

to become old (woman); nagküley 'he is going down'; petu nagmey 'it is low tide' (lit.: it is going down); petu nagmelay 'it is high tide' (lit.: it is not going down); nawpay tañi umaw 'I got sleepy';
downwards, in the direction of the sea;
to go down, to descend; nag- ~ nar- (RR); naw- (JM). nag- occurs frequently in compounds to indicate a downward direction or a deterioration.
downwards, in the direction of the sea.
(in the) afternoon, when the sun is going down; also nag-antü;
wind that comes from the East;
mother-in-law, daughter-in-law (of a woman), wife of the son of a woman's paternal aunt.
tiger; nawel buta 'name of a mountain in the West'.
to untie (a knot, a rope); naytuwüy ti wawa 'the baby untied itself'.
to have, to get (RR); cf. nie-.
to let loose, to let go, to set free; also nelk-üm-; cf. neykü-m- (JM).
to serve out, to dish up.
to move; petu nengümüy 'it is moving'; petu nengümfiy 'he is moving it';
to be moving; allkenngey ti nengümün ti ruka 'one can hear the house shaking'.
to wake up; nepele ñi pichiche, feypiaen 'tell me if my child wakes up';
not very. newe combines with a negative verb. newe kümentukelan 'I don't really like it'; newe doy alülay 'he is not that much taller.
to make an effort, to exert force (on), to put pressure on; newentukieli 'don't be hard on me!'.
to let loose, to let go;
to break loose, to set oneself free.
to have, to hold, to get; nee- ~ nie- (RR); nieyiñ wesha kosecha 'wep have a bad harvest'; nieleyu 'I will hold [it] for yous'; femngen nierpun kiñe ruka 'I finally got a house';
to be pregnant; cf. püñeñ nie- 'to have a child';
to get each other, to get married; eluñmangelayu ya niewal 'wed did not get permission to get married'.
to cross; occurs seldom without a direction marker; nopatunge 'come to this side!, this way!'. Only JM uses no- as a transitive verb; iñche nofiñ ti lewfü 'I crossed the river';
to take across; nolniey lewfümew 'he carries [it] across the river';
across, (on) the opposite side; fey petu weyeliy tañe nometu lewfü puwam 'he swims to get across the river'; nometu ruka 'the house on the opposite side'; penien nometu 'I see the other side';
on this side; nopa pwente 'on this side of the bridge';
to become straight, to go straight (lead an honest life); nortuy 'he went straight again';
to be straight, to stand up straight, to be in a line; norkülechi kalle 'a straight street'; norkülelay 'it is crooked/curved/bent';
to be straight; norngiy ti mapu 'the land is flat'.
no. The negation marker -nu- occurs as a nexal negator, see 26.10. fey nu 'that [is] not him, he [is] not the one'; tüfachi pu che kom mapuche nu? '[are] these people not all Mapuche?.
to take, to grasp, to get, sometimes nüg-; nütuayiñ mapu 'wep are going to take ourp land back'; are nüfin ñi te 'he took his tea hot';
to hold, to hold on to;
to grope about for something, to hold and let go every now and then;
to sniff (RR), 'to smell something from a distance' (MM).
to open; nülakünuñmakielimu tañi malal '[make sure] that he does not leave my fence open';
to smell; müna nümüley ta ruka pütremmew 'the house smells very much of cigarettes';
smell; küme nümünngey 'it has a nice smell'.
to use one's smell to learn what it is;
to smell, to have a sniff at; nümütufiñ ti rayen 'I smelled that flower';
to irritate; also nüngay-tu-; nüngayülmukilyiñ! 'don't irritate usp!'.
to close and let it be closed.
to tell someone, to pass on to;
to talk to, to have a conversation with;
to hand over, to pass on;
to hand over to, to pass on to.
fruit of the chupón, nursing bottle. nüyu is the fruit of the plant Greigia sphacelata (Augusta).
a bird. It is said that this bird lives close to the earth and makes the sound of a crying baby. No-one has actually seen this bird.
to sow, to plant (beans, carrots, potatoes);

to be (existential), to have been (here/there); also ngi- 'to be' (RR); faw ngelay mara 'there are no hare here'; ngewelay 'it is no more, it is finished'; fachantü ngepachi domo 'the woman who was here today'; chew mungel ngemeymi? 'where exactly have yous been?'; ngemefuliiñ kay? 'what if wep went there?';
to take, to bring; iñche ngelmefiñ chi waka 'I took the cow over there';
owner, master; ngen ko 'the master of the water'; eymi ngenolandangeymi? 'are yous the boss of Holland?';
master of speech (the one who says the prayers and conducts the offering of animals during the ngillatun-ceremony). see 21.2 for the verbalizer -nge-.
to eradicate; ngeduley 'it has been pulled up by the roots'.
only after a long time, only just, with great difficulty/effort; also ngellu-ke; ngellu amuy 'he went only after a long time'; ngellu dewmafiñ 'he finished [it] with great difficulty/only just'.
to urge, to press; ngeñikakieli 'don't push me!'.
to wade; ngilaley komew 'he wades through the water'.
Ordering, see 26.4; ngilla dewmalfin ruka 'I had a house built for him'; ngilla ketrañmafalfin ñi mapu 'I have to order him to plough his land'.
to buy; ngillalelfin ruka 'I bought him a house'; ngillaniefin 'I bribed him';
to ask of, to pray; iñche ngillatun kiñe trewa ñi chaw 'I asked my father for a dog';

a feast of one or more days during which people pray, sing and eat together. During the ngillatun, the Mapuche ask the gods and their ancestors for a good harvest and plenty of food for the entire community.
brother-in-law (a sister's husband, husband of a sister-in-law).
to forget; ngoymaniefin 'I have forgotten [all] about it, I don't remember'; ngoymangekey fürenengemum 'one forgets the favours received'.
to wipe (stains, small wounds); wullud- (JM); also ngüllud-.
to forget (MM); also nguyü-; iñche nguyün feychi asul libru 'I forgot that blue book'.
to stop up, to plug, to put the stop on;
to become wet, to make wet; ngüfor- (MM); ngüfofin 'I made it wet (deliberately)';
to dip in and make wet;
to become wet, to make wet (MM); cf. ngüfo-.
to die down, to quiet down; nüküf- (MM); ngüküfkülewetuy tati ruka 'it has already become quiet again in the house';
to come together, to gather; ngülüy ti ko 'the water came together';
to bring together, to gather, to collect; arengülüm- 'to lend something'.
to give advice to; also ngülam-ka- ~ ngülam-tu-.
to take the seeds/stones out of (fruit), to shell (beans, peas), to remove stones out of a piece of land;
without pits, stoned; ngülün mapu 'land from which stones have been removed'.
to wipe (stains, small wounds); also ngullud-.
to cry; wirarüy ñi ngüman 'she cried her heart out';
to be crying all the time, to sob one's heart out;
to cry in a melodramatic/theatrical way.
soft (not rigid/stiff) (JM); ngümfad kawitu 'a soft bed'.
to keep, to preserve, to look after; ngünaytufimamutuayiñ 'preserve usp (from evil, Oh lord)'; ngünaytumey ñi poroto 'she preserves her beans for a long time'.
to rule, to govern, to manage;
god, the one who rules over people;
to examine, to investigate, to scrutinize, to realize;
god, the one who rules over the land;
to be serious, honest, righteous, quiet.
to lie to, to fool, to cheat, to take someone in; also ngünen-kal- ~ ngünen-ka-ntu(l)-;
someone who likes to fool people;
to be deceitful; ñi ngünenngenmew feyentuñmangekelay ñi dungun 'because he is a liar no-one believes what he tells'.
to be hungry; ngüñülen akuayngu 'theyd will be hungry when theyd arrive';
wooden stick to weave the weft through, comb to press down the woven material.
fox, cunning/deceitful; kiñe ngürü wentru 'a cunning man';
jelly of raw blood. Raw, warm blood of a sheep or a goat is mixed with lemon, salt and a sort of parsley to form a jelly. iñche ñachi ta dewman 'I made ñachi';
sister-in-law (sister of a woman's husband, wife of a woman's brother);

just (when), once (if ever), surely (because); ñall küpayael iñche, kiñe wentru akuy 'just when I was about to come, a man arrived (and held me up)'; ñall dungualu iñche, ka che dunguy 'just when I was about to speak, another man started to talk'; ñall amule, amuay 'once it moves, there is no stopping it (e.g. a heavy stone on the edge of a cliff)' (lit.: if it goes, it will go); ñall anta mi doy kimünmu lesulafin pifen 'just because yous know more, yous think you can wrong me'; ñall anta mi ülmenngenmew llükayaeyu 'just because yous are a cacique, yous expect me to be afraid of yous'; ñall anta tami longkongenmew adkaydfin pifen 'just because yous are the leader, yous think yous can manipulate me'.
to get lost, to lose one's way; petufiymi ñamkülechi mansun? 'did yous find the lost ox?';
to lose; iñche ñamümün ñi bolsa 'I lost my bag'.
dear (says a man to a woman).
cat (LQ, RR); also narki (LQ), cf. ñayki.
to find comfort/solace; inayengümayiñ tañi ñawfüam 'wep cried with her so that she would find solace';
ticklish (children and animals, especially wild horses); cf. ñachi;
chief, leader, boss, master; tati ñidol ta, mantaniefiy feychi pu che 'he [is] the boss, he commands these people';
to be the leader, to be in command;
to sow (in little holes in the soil).
to weave a pattern; ñimifin makuñ 'she weaved a poncho with a pattern';
to be weaving with a pattern;
to pick up; ñimitufiñ ta rüpümu 'I picked it up from the street'.
to do one's best (15, 33); cf. ñua- 'to be dishonest, to commit adultery' (Augusta).
to get enough of, to get fed up with; ñoy kofke tachi pichiche 'the baby has had enough of the bread'; iñche ñofiñ 'I am fed up with it'.
slow(ly); tüfachi awto müna ñochi amuley 'that car goes very slowly'; kiñe ñochi wentru 'a man who walks slowly, an easy going man';
mother (of a man or a woman);
mother's sister, stepmother; also ñuke-ye-el; (lit.: the one I have for a mother);
to go to waste (JM); ñumiy ti kusi 'the millstone has gone to waste/cannot be used any more'.
millstone (the top stone, the moving part).
to make someone lose his way.
to calm down cf. ngüküf-; ñüküfkületuy 'it is quiet again';
sheep; also ufisha ~ ufisa; Sp. oveja.
hour; Sp. hora; chem oray? 'what is the time?.
house-post (not RR); Sp. horcón. A house generally has tree posts.
ball, wooden ball with the size of a billiard ball;
a man's or a woman's paternal aunt, children of a woman's brother or sister;
to take on the shoulders; also panü-künu-;
to carry on the shoulders, to have an armful.
a sheltered place in the sun;
to sunbathe in a sheltered place.
dear; is a respectful, sympathetic term to address women. trankinulnge, papay! 'don't fall, dear!'; marimari, papay! 'hallo, dear!';
hundred; Aymara pataka; epu pataka 'two hundred'; pataka kiñe mari epu 'hundred and twelve'.
duck; Sp. pato; karkarkey patu 'a duck quacks'.
to burst open, to explode (an egg or a gasbottle); pawküy ñi chüngküllawto 'my tire burst';
to be burst open, to be exploded.
to lie down on one's back;
to be lying on one's back.
to shave someone, to grasp someone by the beard.

to see, to find, to get; kechu antüy fey ñi pengemum 'it has been five days since anyone saw him'; petufiymi ñamkülechi mansun? 'did yous find the lost ox?'; iñche perumeli fentren plata, kiñe we ruka ngillafemafun 'if I would suddenly get a lot of money, I would immediately buy a new house';
to demonstrate, to show; pengelen rüpü 'show me the road!'; pengelelfinge 'show it to him!';
to greet, to say words of welcome to; pentukuwüy 'they exchanged greetings';
to come to visit; pepaeyumew tayu küme karukatu 'ourd good neighbour came to visit usd';
to find by chance, to come across; also pesha- (JM).
worthless, bad; Sp. pecar; pekan dungu 'nonsense, lie, something stupid'; pekan dungu mekey 'he does all sorts of stupid things (drinking, fighting)';
to mess something up, to ruin something, to spoil;
to behave nasty, to make trouble.
something worthless, trouble; tüfata pekanka dungu nu 'this [is] serious/this [is] not rubbish';
where one cuts off an animal's head;
clay soil; cf. rag 'clay used for pottery';
to get light, to be able to see; peloy 'he can see'; pelolay 'he cannot see, he is blind';
to be light/bright/clear/visible, to be able to see, to have good eyes; peloley 'it is clear, it is visible, there is light';
to illuminate, to light; also pelo-m-tu-;
light, bright; pelon ruka 'a light/bright house'.
to have light, to be light/bright; pelongiy ti pyesa 'the room is bright';
to give light, to see clearly; pelotufiñ 'I gave him light, I saw him clearly';
the hard trunk of a tree (e.g. of an oak tree).

maybe; peno (MM); kuyfi we akulu iñche, rumel peniekefuyiñ wenüy, tüfa pewetulafiñ, penu müliy chi, mülelay chi 'in olden times, when I came back, wep used to see friends, [but] then I did not see them any more, [and I wondered if] they were there or not';
to think that maybe..., to guess; iñche wülewla peno pin 'I thought [that it would be] tomorrow'; iñche feymew peno pin 'I thought that maybe [he would come] from there'.
a man's brother, a man's cousin (son of a paternal uncle or a maternal aunt). peñi is also used by men of more or less equal status to address oneanother.
son of the brother of a man's father;
husband of the sister of a man's wife;
to be peñi in relation to.
being able, see 25.4; papi küdawlan 'I cannot work'; pepi weyelün 'I can swim'; cf. kim weyelün 'I know how to swim';
to prepare, to get ready, to arrange; pepikafiñ ñi küme küdawfengeal 'I prepared him so that he would be a good worker';
to prepare oneself, to get ready;
to be able to do, to understand how to; pepillafin 'I can't do it'; pepiluwlayu 'wed don't understand each other';
possible, manageable; pepilfallay 'it cannot be done'.
to pass away, to lose; Sp. perder(se).
to see ghosts, to have a vision, to see something unusual, to become frightened of.
feather, bundle of feathers (worn as ceremonial attire) (RR, JM); cf. peskiñ;
permission; also permisio; Sp. permiso; eluayu permisio tami amutual 'I gave yous permission to go back';
to ask someone for permission; iñche petu ñi amunun entupermisofiñ ñi ñuke 'before I went, I asked my mother for permission'.
piece, portion (RR); Sp. pedazo; kiñeke petaf elufiy tañi pu wenüy 'he gave a piece to each of his friends.

still, yet. Combined with a perfective verb, petu denotes progress, see 25.3. petu nagüy 'he is going down'; cf. nagüy 'he went down'; petu nagküley 'he is still down'; petu ñi nagnun kullumtuken 'before I go down, I wash my face';
to go on, to be busy (with); petulüy ñi küdawün ~ petu küdawüy 'he is working'.
to be thin, skinny; petrafküley ti kawchu 'that girl has a flat belly.
pine tree, pine cone; Araucaria imbricata (Augusta);
people from the East (who lives in the mountains and collect pine nuts).
to dream (of), probably contains pe- 'to see' and uma-w- 'to sleep'; iñche pewmaeyu 'I dreamt of yous';
oh! I wish/hope...; pewmangen akunufule! 'oh! I wish they would not come!.
to bud, to sprout; petu pewüy koyam 'the oak tree is budding';

to say, to intend, to want (to do). The verb pi- 'to say' is predominantly used to close a direct quote, whereas fey-pi- 'to say (to)' is used to introduce a direct quote; wotayayiñ, piy tati pu wingka "wep shall vote", the strangers said'; wüle tripayan pilen 'I intend to leave tomorrow'; fey piy ñi amual, iñche pilan 'he wanted to go, I did not'; müley ñi pial 'he has to want [it]';
to say the same thing over and over again.
a herb; Fabiana imbricata R. et Pav., fam. Solanaceae (Augusta).

little, small, young, a little; pichi ~ püchi ~ püchü ~ püti ~ pütü (RR); fill pichike küdaw müley 'there are all sorts of small jobs [to do]'; pichi mawünüy 'it rained a little'; pichi alün waka 'cow of an average size';
to be little/small; pichilan 'I am not small';
to be little/small; pichiley 'there is little';
a small quantity; ngillay pichin mapu 'he bought a little land'; doy pichin lifru 'less books'; cf. doy pichi lifru 'smaller books';
after a little while, a little while later;
to stay a little while, to take a little while; pichintuy ñi küdaw 'my work did not take long'; pichintufiñ ñi küdaw 'I spent a little time on my work';
to stay/take a little while; pichiñmamen Temuko 'I was in Temuco for a little while'; pichiñmay mikro 'the bus was delayed for a little while';
legume (peas and beans); pidku- ~ pisku- (RR); also pishku;
disc made of clay or lead attached to the end of a distaff.
flute, wooden flute of about 25 centimeters long.
to veer towards the North, to become northern wind;
to be northern wind, to look like northern wind;
people from the North; also piku-m-che;
to be deaf (temporarily), to play deaf;
ear (organ), ear (of an object like a cup).
to catch, to surprise; Sp. pillar.
to blow (up), to inflate; pimuenew ti nge 'he blew in my eye'.
straw, also used as a general term for reed; pinu ruka nien 'I have a house with a thatched roof'; pinu küna 'küna reed'; pinu rüme 'rüme reed';
a place with a lot of reed, haystack.
to snow, to hail; petu pirey 'it is snowing, it is hailing';
to be covered with snow/hail, to be snowing, to be snowy, to rain down, to be hailing, to look like hail.
to be crazy (temporarily), to act crazy;
to be mentally ill, to be crazy.
legume (peas and beans) (used by old women (RR)); pisko (JM); see pidku.
to peep (MM, JM); also pishpishg-; pispismekey pichike achawall 'the chicks are peeping'.
legume (peas and beans); see pidku, pisku.
to get a blister; pitrawüy ñi namun 'my foot blistered';
to peck, to pick; feytüfachi achawall pitrongfiy tüyechi achawall 'this chicken pecked at that chicken over there'.
to get scabies; pitruley 'he has got scabies'.
to have a warm heart, to be generous.
to dry; petu piwümuwün 'I am drying myself';
dried up, dry; cf. angkün 'dry (bone dry)'; piwün küchatun 'dry laundry'; piwün mamüll 'dry wood';
money, silver; Sp. plata; plata trarilongkotukünungiy 'she was put on a silver headdress'.
to be poor (temporarily), to have little money;
broche, a needle of 10-20 centimetres with a silver ball on the top end; Sp. punzón.
to flicker (light), to waver; ponünponünngey küde 'the torch is wavering'.
well; Sp. pozo; feytichi poso alükonüy 'that well is very deep';
to topple; potritripan ti wangkumu 'I toppled out of the chair';
to get a boil, to get a swollen...; poyman ñi namun 'I got an abscess in my foot'.
to caress, to fondle, to be fond of, to respect;
beloved, well-liked, respected, spoilt; rume poyen wentru tüfa 'that [is] a well-beloved man'.
in, see 10.5; puwüy pu malliñ 'he landed in a lake'; pu wallentu 'in the middle of the bushes'; ütrüftukun kiñe fotella pulku pu lewfü 'I threw a botlle of wine in the river'.

to arrive; also puw-. The distribution of pu(w)- is not entirely clear. puw- is most frequent. I found pu-fu-n 'I arrived, but' (RR) and iñche pu-n 'I arrived' (JM), and I found puw-küle-28 (RR) only once; müna ayuwüy iñchiu yu puwel 'he was very glad that wed had arrived'; küpa pulen liwen 'I want to arrive early'; petu puwlaymi küdawmew 'yous are too young to work';
to be good at; iñche pulen tüfachi küdawmew 'I am good at this work'; iñche petu pulen lefünmew 'I can still run';

to fulfill, to reach, to deliver, to arrive with; femngechi puwülüy ñi antü, lay 'and thus his time had come and he died'; puwülüy epu mari tripantu 'he reached the age of twenty'; meñku puwülüy 'he arrived with a bag'.
wine, liquor; metawe pulku 'a jar of wine'; pütokofiñ ti pulku 'I drank that wine';
to drink wine; pichi pulkutukünuan 'I am going to have a few drinks'.
late at night; alüpuniy 'it has become/is late at night'; also fücha-pun;
to go to bed late at night.
late in the evening (after about 21.00 hours);
to be at nightfall, to spend the night;
to become thick, to spread, to become dispersed; püdiy ti ufisha 'the sheep dispersed'; püdpüdküley 'it is all over the place';
white (JM); also pilang; cf. fülang, Sp. blanco.
plant with seven veins (JM); Modiola caroliniana Don, fam. Malvaceae (Augusta).
inside of the hand/foot (RR); cf. pülapüla;
climbing plant (JM); Mühlenbeckia tamnifolia Meisn., fam. Polygonaceae (Augusta).
side, direction, see 10.4; külañ püle podküliy 'it is dirty on three sides';
on both/two sides; also epu-ñ püle-tu;
after midnight, more than halfway through the night;
in the direction of the sea; tüfa püle mülekefun kuyfi 'I used to live here';
in the direction of the sea, downwards;
to the East (where the sun comes up).
close, near; pülle ta müliy tañi ruka 'the house is nearby'; Xasinta küdawkiy pülle iñchiu 'Jacinta works near usp';

1 to approach, to come/go near;

1) -DM- means that at that position it needs one of the direction markers, [+TH@me20] thither or [+HH@pa17] hither.
to approach, to come/go near; pülleketuniewüymu kam kamapu niewüymu? 'do youd live close to one another or far away from each other?';
soul, spirit, earth (land that lies fallow, e.g. wasteland or the floor in a house); kolü püllü 'brown earth';
to invoke the spirit of a sick person in order to establish the nature of his disease (work of the machi).
to stick, to glue; pünaeyew ti chiklet 'she got stuck to her chewing gum'; pünafiñ 'I stuck to her, I hung around her';
to use, to employ; iñche arelfiñ kiñe kareta eymi mi püneal 'I borrowed a cart so that yous could use it'; pünefiñ ti kawellu 'I used the horse';
to step on, to trample on, to humiliate;
apart, separately; püntü amuley 'they go separately'; püntüke fendelan mesa engün wangku 'I don't sell the tables without the chairs';
to separate; püntüwüyngu 'theyd separated'; püntüley ti ufisha 'that sheep goes on its own';
(a woman's child, her sister's child, child of her husband's brother, child of her father's sister); iñche püñeñ nien 'I have a child';
to be giving birth, to be still able to get children;
a man's daughter-in-law, a woman's father-in-law, brother of her husband's mother, brother of her husband's father.
to bring/take up, to raise; pichi püramüy ketran re ñi chofüngen mütem 'he produced little wheat just because he is lazy';
to make a knot in, to tie;
knot, tied with a knot/knots; püron llasu 'a rope with knots, a fastened rope'.
in a moment, immediately, quickly; pürüm amuan 'I will go in a moment'; pürüm pümnge! 'go up immediately!'; pürüm eluayu 'I will give [it] to yous quickly'.
to sputter, to splash, to sprinkle; püteftripay '[sparks] sputtered out';

to drink (not alcohol), to drink water; contains ko 'water'. püto-ko- is more often used as a general term for drinking non-alcoholic beverages than the verb püto-; rume küpa pütokon 'I would very much like to drink (water)'; küpa pütokon ko 'I want to drink water'. JM uses püto-ko- as a general term for drinking (alcoholic and non-alcoholic beverages); pütokofiñ ti pulku 'I drank that wine';
to burn; pütrefiñ ñi kuwümew 'I burned it in my hand'.
to smoke; feyengün pütremtukelay 'theyp don't smoke'; pütremtukünayu 'let usd smoke first'.
to be tall, to be big (age), to be much;
to be much; pütrüley 'there is a lot';
big, much; iñche pütrün dungu kimnien 'I know a lot of things'; pütrüken mansunmew küdawkefuy che 'people worked with a lot of oxen';
to be able; derived from Sp. poder; pwedenuliiñ 'if wep can't'.
the; see 14.3; pepillafin ta küdaw 'I can't do this job';
the; ta-tüfa, tüfa-ta, ta-chi, see tüfa; fey-ta, see fey.
to cover; iñche takuwün 'I covered myself';
daddy; also chacha, which has a more affectionate connotation.
just now, a moment ago; iñche tayi pu liwen mikrotupen 'I have taken the bus this morning'; iñche doy tayi akutuafun 'I might have come a little bit sooner'.
to remove, to depose; taymaentungepay ta fütake longkoyem 'the former old leaders have been deposed'.
the, ti ~ chi (RR); see 14.3; küme adngey ti/chi pichi señora 'that young lady looks pretty';
to spit at, to spit out;
stick on which the warp is fastened with threads in order to make a weaving pattern; also püra-m-tonon-we.
all saints' day; Sp. (fiesta de) Todos los Santos.
to get hold of, to take (out); tun ñi kutran tranel ñi rukamew 'I got injured when I fell in my house'; tuñmafiñ Rosa ñi kutran 'I contract my illness from Rosa';
to come from, to start; cf. tuw-.
which?; tuchi ~ chuchi (RR); tuchi rüpü inayan? 'which way shall I go?'; tuchi tami lamngen? 'which one [is] yours sister?';
not any, none; tuchikünu-w- 'to go where?'.

to put (in/on/at), to plant; in compounds also -ntuku-; iñche tukukünulelfiñ kiñe trapelakucha tami kure ñi üküllamew 'I put a broche on the shawl of yours wife'; tukufiñ kasetmew 'I put it (the tape) in the tape recorder'; tukuniengekefuy küdawmew 'they used to be put to work';
to let someone know beforehand, to warn;
to have known/understood for some time; kimtukufiñ 'I have known him for ever';

how (much)?; tunte ~ chunte (RR); tunte püray? 'how high is it?'; tunte kamapuleyngu chiam? 'how far away are theyd?'; iñche ñi mapu petu kimlan ñi tunte puwün 'I still don't know how far my land extends';
how much?; tuntenmu ngillaymi? 'for how much did yous buy [it]?'; tunten antü? 'how late is it?';
how much time?; tuntentu müleayu? 'for how long shall wed stay?';
to stay/to be for how long; tuntentuy faw? 'how long did he stay here?';
to stay/be for how long, to take how long; tunteñmamen? 'for how long did I stay there?'; müte tunteñmakelay ñi dewmangeayem kiñe ruka 'it does not take that much time to build a house';
broche, a silver disc with a needle of about 25 centimeters.
never (with negative verb); eymi turpu tripakelaymi 'yous never go out'.
to please, to satisfy, to do good; tuteay mi dungu 'it will do yours business good'; tunte kümelkakünulelfili rume, tutelayafin 'no matter how well I do it for him, I can't satisfy him';
to be pleased (with what one has (done)), to get on well together.

to come from, to originate from, to begin. tuw- may be related to tu- 'to get hold of, to take (out)'. chew tuwüymi? 'where do yous come from?'; iñche Chile tuwün 'I come from Chile'; iñche tuwün ñi küdawal 'I began to work'. tuw-(?) is also found in: alü-tuw- 'to be long'; fentre-tuw- 'to be long'; fücha-tuw- 'to be long'; pichi-tuw- 'to be short'; pütrü-tuw- 'to be long'; tüfachi kalle pichituwüy 'this street is short'; fey müna tuwüy 'he can run fast'.
earth, soil, lump; fey takufiyiñ tuwemew 'wep covered him with earth'.
this, then, now; tüfa norküley 'this (one) is straight'; tüfa ruka 'this [is] a house'; iñchiñ tüfa konayiñ 'at that moment wep will come in'; tüfa püle '(on) this side';
this; tüfachi ruka pichikay 'this house is small'; see fa-chi:
that; tüfey ~ tüfiy (RR); tüfey! 'here! (take it)'; tüfey chem chekay? 'what [would] that be?'
that; tüfeychi wentru ella ayeley 'that man is laughing a bit'. fey is used much more often than tüfey, see 14.
to calm down, to take long, to stay on;
to die down, to decrease, to become quiet;
that over there; also üye; tüye iniy chekay? 'who [is] there?/who would that be?'; tüye püle 'in that direction over there';
that over there; also üye-chi, tie-chi;
over there; also üyemew ~ üyümu ~ tüyü-w ~ üyüw.

At the bottom of the pendant there often is a silver cross. The term trapelakucha is also used to refer to a large silver broche (20 cm long and 10 cm wide) which consists of an upper plate in the form of two birds which is linked by means of three chains of about 12 flat links to a bottom plate adorned with a row of silver coins.

to get together, to gather, to meet; also trawu-w-; küla wentru trawüwüyngün wiya 'yesterday three men got together';

foam, froth; petu tripay tror 'foam is coming out (of the casserole)';

something disgusting, a repulsive person, bastard, son-of-a-bitch (rude); also weda ünun; matuke amunge, wedaünun pichi wentru, kulliñmew! 'go immediately, stupid boy, go to the cattle!.
to be yawning all the time.

man; wentrupüñeñ 'son (male child of a woman)'; wentruüñüm 'male bird'; pichiwentru 'young man';

to have sexual intercourse with (a man);
space above something, firmament, above; wenu ruka(mew) müpüyawüy 'he is flying around above the house'; wenuke mamüll 'above each tree'; wenu ashün 'the beauty of the firmament';

then, until; kuduleay ta kutran, tremole wüla witrayay 'the patient must stay in bed, if he gets better, then he may get up'; küpale wüla amuan 'I will go the moment he comes'; tripalayaymi rukamew iñche wiñoli wüla 'don't go out of the house until I get back'; epu mari tripantu wüla puwülüymi fey pütremtuaymi 'when yous will be twenty years old, yous are allowed to smoke (don't smoke before you are twenty years old)';
right now, this minute; also fey-wüla-wüla;
tomorrow; only wüle (JM, MM); also wile;
to hit, to slap, to smack, to stump.
front, (immediately) in front, near the door; wülngiñ ñi ruka(mew) müliy kiñe walle 'right in front of my house there is a tree'.
dawn, at dawn; epe wün tripay 'he left when it was almost dawn';
to dawn; petu ñi wünnun rume 'before it dawns';
to experience dawn, to see the sun rise;
the next day, the following morning.
first(ly), sooner, in front; wüne puwüy 'he arrived first'; iñchiumew wüne puwüy 'he arrived ahead of usd'; wüneke puwchi che 'the ones who arrived first';
to be the first, to precede; wünenge 'after you!';
to let someone go first, to do something first (before somebody else);
to be first, to be in front;
first (MM); wünelumew mülepuy 'he is there first';
first, elder, eldest; iñche ñi wünen 'my elder (brother or sister)'.
to snap all of them/everywhere; wünfükawkülerkiy ti mamüll wenu '(I understand that) a lot [of branches] high up in the tree have snapped'.
to be stretched; wünülefuy ñi dungu 'their problems had accumulated';
to become sad, to become homesick (for), to long for (MM); cf. weñangkü-.
smell, odour; küme würwanngey 'it has a nice smell';
to inhale the odour, to sniff up.
cold; wütre antü 'a cold day'; makuntunge chafoafuymi wütremew 'put on a coat, yous might catch a cold because of the cold';
bad, badly (RR); also würa; cf. wesha.
to become dizzy, to become sick; wiyü- (JM);
to become thirsty; iñche wüywün küdawel 'I got thirsty when I was working';
to make someone angry; cf. yafkü-.

both, together (but not equally); yag tremkülerpuyiñ 'wep grew up together (being of different age/in different circumstances)'; cf. trür tremkülerpuyiñ 'wep grew up together (being of more or less the same age/in more or less similar circumstances)'.
child (of a man); feychi wentru meli niy yall feychi domomu 'that man has four children with that woman';
to beget, to multiply; yallngey 'he was begotten';
to bring, to carry; yeniey ina lewfü 'he carries [it] along the river'; yelelenew 'he brought [it] for me'; küme yenien ñi küdaw 'I am good at my work';
to join someone in, to follow someone in;
to take after (in character and features); yepa- ~ yepa-ntu- (MM); yepaenew 'he takes after me'.
to be ashamed to, to respect someone, to be shy with; rume yewengey 'he was much respected'; yewefiñ 'I respected him, I was shy towards him'; iñche yewefun ñi feypiafiel 'I was ashamed to tell him';
to bring shame on someone, to embarrass;
things, stuff, belongings; probably drived from ye-.
fat (human and animal); yiwiñ sañwe 'pig's fat'.
to be enough; yochilefuy chiam ñi iyael? 'would the food be enough?'.
to go on, to go beyond what is planned for/what is advisable, to go too far, to do better than others; yom dewmay 'he built another, bigger one';
sharp; yungumke kuchillu nien 'I have sharp knives';
